Data Processing Utilities

The data_processing module provides utilities for cleaning, filtering, and preparing production data for decline curve analysis.

Data processing utilities for decline curve analysis.

This module contains helper functions for cleaning, filtering, and preparing production data for decline curve analysis.

decline_analysis.utils.data_processing.remove_nan_and_zeroes(df, column)[source]

Filter out NaN values and zeroes from a specified column.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – Input DataFrame

  • column (str) – Name of column to filter

Return type:

DataFrame

Returns:

Filtered DataFrame with NaN’s and zeroes removed from specified column

Example

>>> df_clean = remove_nan_and_zeroes(df, 'oil_bbl')
decline_analysis.utils.data_processing.calculate_days_online(df, date_column, online_date_column)[source]

Calculate cumulative days online for each record.

Creates a column showing the time delta between when the well came online and each production record date.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – Input DataFrame

  • date_column (str) – Name of column with record dates (datetime)

  • online_date_column (str) – Name of column with well online date (datetime)

Return type:

Series

Returns:

Series containing days online for each record

Example

>>> df['days_online'] = calculate_days_online(df, 'ReportDate', 'Online_Date')
decline_analysis.utils.data_processing.get_grouped_min_max(df, group_column, calc_column, calc_type='min')[source]

Get min or max value for a column with grouping applied.

Useful for finding earliest/latest dates or min/max production by well.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – Input DataFrame

  • group_column (str) – Column name to group by (e.g., ‘well_id’)

  • calc_column (str) – Column name to calculate min/max for

  • calc_type (str) – Either ‘min’ or ‘max’

Return type:

Series

Returns:

Series with min/max values for each group

Example

>>> # Get earliest date for each well
>>> df['first_date'] = get_grouped_min_max(df, 'well_id', 'date', 'min')
decline_analysis.utils.data_processing.get_max_initial_production(df, n_months, production_column, date_column)[source]

Get maximum production from first N months (handles ramp-up period).

Useful for determining initial production rate (qi) when wells have a ramp-up period before reaching peak production.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – Input DataFrame (should be for single well)

  • n_months (int) – Number of initial months to consider

  • production_column (str) – Name of production column (e.g., ‘oil_bbl’)

  • date_column (str) – Name of date column

Return type:

float

Returns:

Maximum production value from first N months

Example

>>> qi = get_max_initial_production(well_df, 3, 'oil_bbl', 'date')
decline_analysis.utils.data_processing.calculate_cumulative_production(df, production_column, group_column=None)[source]

Calculate cumulative production over time.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – Input DataFrame

  • production_column (str) – Name of production column

  • group_column (Optional[str]) – Optional column to group by (for multiple wells)

Return type:

Series

Returns:

Series with cumulative production

Example

>>> df['cum_oil'] = calculate_cumulative_production(df, 'oil_bbl', 'well_id')
decline_analysis.utils.data_processing.normalize_production_to_daily(df, production_column, days_column, output_column=None)[source]

Convert monthly production totals to daily rates.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – Input DataFrame

  • production_column (str) – Name of column with monthly production

  • days_column (str) – Name of column with days in period

  • output_column (Optional[str]) – Optional name for output column

Return type:

Series

Returns:

Series with daily production rates

Example

>>> df['oil_rate'] = normalize_production_to_daily(df, 'Oil', 'Days')
decline_analysis.utils.data_processing.filter_wells_by_date_range(df, date_column, start_date, end_date, well_column=None)[source]

Filter wells that came online within a date range.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – Input DataFrame

  • date_column (str) – Name of date column

  • start_date (Union[str, Timestamp]) – Start of date range

  • end_date (Union[str, Timestamp]) – End of date range

  • well_column (Optional[str]) – Optional well identifier column

Return type:

DataFrame

Returns:

Filtered DataFrame

Example

>>> df_2016 = filter_wells_by_date_range(df, 'Online_Date', '2016-01-01', '2016-12-31')
decline_analysis.utils.data_processing.calculate_water_cut(df, oil_column='Oil', water_column='Wtr')[source]

Calculate water cut percentage.

Water cut = Water / (Oil + Water) * 100

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – Input DataFrame

  • oil_column (str) – Name of oil production column

  • water_column (str) – Name of water production column

Return type:

Series

Returns:

Series with water cut percentages

Example

>>> df['water_cut'] = calculate_water_cut(df, 'Oil', 'Wtr')
decline_analysis.utils.data_processing.calculate_gor(df, gas_column='Gas', oil_column='Oil')[source]

Calculate Gas-Oil Ratio (GOR).

GOR = Gas / Oil (typically in scf/bbl or mcf/bbl)

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – Input DataFrame

  • gas_column (str) – Name of gas production column

  • oil_column (str) – Name of oil production column

Return type:

Series

Returns:

Series with GOR values

Example

>>> df['gor'] = calculate_gor(df, 'Gas', 'Oil')
decline_analysis.utils.data_processing.prepare_well_data_for_dca(df, well_id, well_column='API_WELLNO', date_column='ReportDate', production_column='Oil', remove_zeros=True)[source]

Prepare single well data for decline curve analysis.

Convenience function that combines filtering, sorting, and formatting steps to create a clean time series ready for DCA.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – Input DataFrame with multiple wells

  • well_id (Union[str, int]) – Identifier for the specific well

  • well_column (str) – Name of well identifier column

  • date_column (str) – Name of date column

  • production_column (str) – Name of production column

  • remove_zeros (bool) – Whether to remove zero/null values

Return type:

Series

Returns:

Time series indexed by date with production values

Example

>>> series = prepare_well_data_for_dca(df, '33023013930000', production_column='Oil')
>>> forecast = dca.forecast(series, model='arps', horizon=12)
decline_analysis.utils.data_processing.detect_production_anomalies(series, threshold_std=3.0)[source]

Detect anomalous production values using standard deviation.

Flags values that are more than threshold_std standard deviations from the rolling mean.

Parameters:

  • series (Series) – Production time series

  • threshold_std (float) – Number of standard deviations for threshold

Return type:

Series

Returns:

Boolean series indicating anomalies

Example

>>> anomalies = detect_production_anomalies(oil_series, threshold_std=3.0)
>>> print(f"Found {anomalies.sum()} anomalies")

Filter out NaN values and zeroes from a specified column.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – Input DataFrame

  • column (str) – Name of column to filter

Return type:

DataFrame

Returns:

Filtered DataFrame with NaN’s and zeroes removed from specified column

Example

>>> df_clean = remove_nan_and_zeroes(df, 'oil_bbl')
decline_analysis.utils.data_processing.filter_wells_by_date_range(df, date_column, start_date, end_date, well_column=None)[source]

Filter wells that came online within a date range.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – Input DataFrame

  • date_column (str) – Name of date column

  • start_date (Union[str, Timestamp]) – Start of date range

  • end_date (Union[str, Timestamp]) – End of date range

  • well_column (Optional[str]) – Optional well identifier column

Return type:

DataFrame

Returns:

Filtered DataFrame

Example

>>> df_2016 = filter_wells_by_date_range(df, 'Online_Date', '2016-01-01', '2016-12-31')

Calculate cumulative days online for each record.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – Input DataFrame

  • date_column (str) – Name of column with record dates (datetime)

  • online_date_column (str) – Name of column with well online date (datetime)

Return type:

Series

Returns:

Series containing days online for each record

decline_analysis.utils.data_processing.get_grouped_min_max(df, group_column, calc_column, calc_type='min')[source]

Get min or max value for a column with grouping applied.

Useful for finding earliest/latest dates or min/max production by well.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – Input DataFrame

  • group_column (str) – Column name to group by (e.g., ‘well_id’)

  • calc_column (str) – Column name to calculate min/max for

  • calc_type (str) – Either ‘min’ or ‘max’

Return type:

Series

Returns:

Series with min/max values for each group

Example

>>> # Get earliest date for each well
>>> df['first_date'] = get_grouped_min_max(df, 'well_id', 'date', 'min')

Production Metrics

decline_analysis.utils.data_processing.calculate_cumulative_production(df, production_column, group_column=None)[source]

Calculate cumulative production over time.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – Input DataFrame

  • production_column (str) – Name of production column

  • group_column (Optional[str]) – Optional column to group by (for multiple wells)

Return type:

Series

Returns:

Series with cumulative production

Example

>>> df['cum_oil'] = calculate_cumulative_production(df, 'oil_bbl', 'well_id')
decline_analysis.utils.data_processing.normalize_production_to_daily(df, production_column, days_column, output_column=None)[source]

Convert monthly production totals to daily rates.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – Input DataFrame

  • production_column (str) – Name of column with monthly production

  • days_column (str) – Name of column with days in period

  • output_column (Optional[str]) – Optional name for output column

Return type:

Series

Returns:

Series with daily production rates

Example

decline_analysis.utils.data_processing.get_max_initial_production(df, n_months, production_column, date_column)[source]

Get maximum production from first N months (handles ramp-up period).

Useful for determining initial production rate (qi) when wells have a ramp-up period before reaching peak production.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – Input DataFrame (should be for single well)

  • n_months (int) – Number of initial months to consider

  • production_column (str) – Name of production column (e.g., ‘oil_bbl’)

  • date_column (str) – Name of date column

Return type:

float

Returns:

Maximum production value from first N months

Example

>>> qi = get_max_initial_production(well_df, 3, 'oil_bbl', 'date')

Quality Control

decline_analysis.utils.data_processing.detect_production_anomalies(series, threshold_std=3.0)[source]

Detect anomalous production values using standard deviation.

Flags values that are more than threshold_std standard deviations from the rolling mean.

Parameters:

  • series (Series) – Production time series

  • threshold_std (float) – Number of standard deviations for threshold

Return type:

Series

Returns:

Boolean series indicating anomalies

Example

>>> anomalies = detect_production_anomalies(oil_series, threshold_std=3.0)
>>> print(f"Found {anomalies.sum()} anomalies")

Convenience Functions

decline_analysis.utils.data_processing.prepare_well_data_for_dca(df, well_id, well_column='API_WELLNO', date_column='ReportDate', production_column='Oil', remove_zeros=True)[source]

Prepare single well data for decline curve analysis.

Convenience function that combines filtering, sorting, and formatting steps to create a clean time series ready for DCA.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – Input DataFrame with multiple wells

  • well_id (Union[str, int]) – Identifier for the specific well

  • well_column (str) – Name of well identifier column

  • date_column (str) – Name of date column

  • production_column (str) – Name of production column

  • remove_zeros (bool) – Whether to remove zero/null values

Return type:

Series

Returns:

Time series indexed by date with production values

Example

>>> series = prepare_well_data_for_dca(df, '33023013930000', production_column='Oil')
>>> forecast = dca.forecast(series, model='arps', horizon=12)

Examples

Data Cleaning

import pandas as pd
from decline_analysis.utils import data_processing as dp

# Load raw production data
df = pd.read_csv('production.csv')

# Remove invalid data
df_clean = dp.remove_nan_and_zeroes(df, 'oil')

print(f"Records before: {len(df)}")
print(f"Records after: {len(df_clean)}")

Calculating Production Metrics

# Calculate water cut
df['water_cut'] = dp.calculate_water_cut(df, 'Oil', 'Wtr')

# Calculate GOR
df['gor'] = dp.calculate_gor(df, 'Gas', 'Oil')

# Calculate cumulative production
df['cum_oil'] = dp.calculate_cumulative_production(df, 'Oil', 'well_id')

print(f"Average water cut: {df['water_cut'].mean():.1f}%")
print(f"Average GOR: {df['gor'].mean():.1f} mcf/bbl")

Quick Data Preparation

# Prepare well data for DCA in one line
series = dp.prepare_well_data_for_dca(
    df,
    well_id='WELL_001',
    well_column='API_WELLNO',
    date_column='ReportDate',
    production_column='Oil',
    remove_zeros=True
)

# Ready for forecasting
from decline_analysis import dca
forecast = dca.forecast(series, model='arps', horizon=12)

Anomaly Detection

# Detect production anomalies
anomalies = dp.detect_production_anomalies(
    oil_series,
    threshold_std=3.0
)

print(f"Anomalies detected: {anomalies.sum()}")
print(f"Anomaly dates: {oil_series[anomalies].index.tolist()}")

Calculating Initial Production Rate

# Get maximum production from first 3 months
# (handles ramp-up period)
qi = dp.get_max_initial_production(
    df,
    n_months=3,
    production_column='Oil',
    date_column='ReportDate'
)

print(f"Initial production rate (qi): {qi:.0f} bbl/month")

Days Online Calculation

# Calculate days online for each record
df['Online_Date'] = dp.get_grouped_min_max(
    df, 'well_id', 'ReportDate', 'min'
)

df['Days_Online'] = dp.calculate_days_online(
    df, 'ReportDate', 'Online_Date'
)

print(f"Well has been online for {df['Days_Online'].max()} days")
